definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You only got to say she was blankly?
sentences.chinese: 照说这姑娘还真是直肠子。

sentences.english: It's my guts sucked into the drain.
sentences.chinese: 是我的肠子给吸进了下水口。

sentences.english: You usually know what he is thinking, because he shoots from the hip.
sentences.chinese: 一般你能知道他在想什么，因为他是根直肠子。

sentences.english: And after all this the LORD smote him in his bowels with an incurable disease.
sentences.chinese: 这些事以后，耶和华使约兰的肠子患不能医治的病。

sentences.english: U. S. A's tharm is not so long that it will get indigestion when it swallows Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 美国的肠子没有那么长，吞进伊拉克，会消化不良。

sentences.english: It will cut your intestines into pieces if you are foolish enough to swallow me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愚蠢地吞了我，它就会把你的肠子划成碎片。

sentences.english: It shows a fox being disembowelled by a pack of hounds.
sentences.chinese: 画面中一只狐狸正被一群猎狗撕咬得肠子外流。

sentences.english: No one fainted the first time I read the short story, 'Guts'.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次读《肠子》这个短篇故事的时候没人晕倒。

sentences.english: Huahuachangzi not too much, there will be no marriage crisis.
sentences.chinese: 花花肠子不要太多，婚姻就不会有危机。
去虾壳和虾背上的肠子。

sentences.english: Picture your gut chakra opening in a slow-motion explosion of sausage-casing small intestine.
sentences.chinese: 想象下你肠子如同裹了肠衣般四处飞散的慢镜头。

sentences.english: In all, 67 people have fainted while I've read 'Guts'.
sentences.chinese: 合计有67个人在我读《肠子》的时候晕倒。

sentences.english: Salts is a medicine that causes movements of the bowels .
sentences.chinese: 泻盐是一种促使肠子运动的药物。

sentences.english: Nancy:I keep fantasizing about strangling him with his own guts.
sentences.chinese: 我不断想像用他自己的肠子把他勒死。

sentences.english: After all this, the Lord afflicted Jehoram with an incurable disease of the bowels.
sentences.chinese: 这些事以后，耶和华使约兰的肠子患不能医治的病。

definition: to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
erhua variant of 屁眼[pi4 yan3]
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
